result.execSummary:
The defendant William E. Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraud. Use >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Milwaukee Co case 14-CF-1587.& Waukesha Co Case 12-CF-631 & Racine Co Case 13-CF-926.

superMiscConds.notes: Prison account is subject to collection for restitution.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previoulsy paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges with co defts:  15-CM-108 & 15-CM-109.  May Not have contact with St Catherine's or any hospital unless there for his own treatment.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B. Ekes.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  On state's motion counts 1 and 3 are dismissed but read in.  Deft pleads guilty; court finds defendant guilty.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP concurrent to Milwaukee County case 14CF1587; 3 years initial confinement with credit for 12 days served, 3 years extended supervision with conditions.  Deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250.00 surcharge.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $250.00 (by stipulation of deft) joint and several with 15CM108 and 15CM109.  Prison account is subject to collection for restitution.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ekes requests to hold his motion to withdraw in abeyance, believes case can be resolved.  PLEAH set for 5/24/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Delgado. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. PPPD Det. Laura Hoffman sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Bielski. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-18-15 @ 1:30pm with co-def. in 15CM108. Bond continued.
No contact with Kathleen M., Michael. D.W., Korea K.B. or any of their residences, Target in Pleasant Prairie, Walgreens in Kenosha, St. Catherine's Hospital except for emergencies.
